channel.title: Expanding tiles?
channel.description:
[quote="MybJames, post:5, topic:114827"]along side the tiles being clipped by the view frustum, tile visibility is initially determined by the visibility map (a boolean array array array array [array?]), which must be expanded. fog of war cannot be removed, but merely expanded so that it is not detected by the user. tracing through the stack is a an exercise in masochism and is relatively futile.[/quote] aBooleanArrayArrayArrayArray491 in WorldController.java, method310 is what he's talking about, I believe.
What exactly does it mean to "expand" the tiles?

item.title: Expanding tiles?
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:5, topic:204448”][quote author=Zachera link=topic=269945.msg2217268#msg2217268 date=1210283328]
Wouldn’t raising the size of the array screw the whole thing over?

I attempted to change all 104 values in the client to 208 last night, but nothing changed.
[/quote]
you need to change each forloop where they loop through the array, and where they init it.[/quote]
I’m curious as to know whether I have to mess with anything in client.java? Or does it automatically handle every change made with the WorldController?

Read full topic

item.title: Expanding tiles?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

shutup you suck

at the moment, the array is something like [8][32][51][51], the tile displaying is restricted to 25 tiles in any direction, so amongst other things, you might resize this array

item.title: Expanding tiles?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

It means, NO PRIVATE SERVER QUESTION HERE.

Don’t say else, because there’s no such thing a WorldController.java anymore
(unless you are very smart, and move all the static world controller methods to one class lol)

Read full topic

item.title: Expanding tiles?
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“MybJames, post:5, topic:114827”]along side the tiles being clipped by the view frustum, tile visibility is initially determined by the visibility map (a boolean array array array array [array?]), which must be expanded.
fog of war cannot be removed, but merely expanded so that it is not detected by the user. tracing through the stack is a an exercise in masochism and is relatively futile.[/quote]
aBooleanArrayArrayArrayArray491 in WorldController.java, method310 is what he’s talking about, I believe.

What exactly does it mean to “expand” the tiles?
